meanings.definition: The quality of being curious or inquisitive.
meanings.sent1: Her cariosities led her to explore the hidden corners of the library.
meanings.sent2: Children's cariosities often drive them to ask many questions.
meanings.sent3: His cariosities about the mysterious noise in the attic made him brave enough to investigate.
meanings.sent4: The cariosities of the detective were like a torch, illuminating every dark corner of the case.
meanings.sent5: The cariosities of the cat were endless, always pawing at new things to discover.

meanings.definition: A strange or unusual object or fact.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed various cariosities from around the world.
meanings.sent2: The old house was filled with cariosities that intrigued the visitors.
meanings.sent3: The cariosities found in the abandoned warehouse puzzled the investigators.
meanings.sent4: The cariosities in the antique shop seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: Among the cariosities on the shelf, one item stood out as particularly odd.

meanings.definition: A strong desire to know or learn something.
meanings.sent1: His cariosities about the universe led him to study astronomy.
meanings.sent2: The professor's cariosities drove him to research new theories.
meanings.sent3: The cariosities of the students were sparked by the intriguing science experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her cariosities burned like a flame, never satisfied with surface-level answers.
meanings.sent5: The cariosities of the young explorer propelled him to venture into the unknown jungle.
